GREESDK(Unity) Documentation
Click here to download this release.
Please let us know what works and does not work for you.
If you are upgrading an existing project, then please see the Unity-iOS Release Notes as there are important instructions on how to do that.
Note: This version of the Unity plugin for iOS requires XCode 4.x.
Let's walk through an OpenFeint + Unity iOS integration example.
If you are planning on integrating this into an existing project, then please make a backup of your project prior to integrating OpenFeint.

It is assumed that you have the following installed:

  • OSX 10.6 or later
  • Unity 3.3 or later
  • XCode 4.0.2 or later and iOS SDK 4.3 or later from iOS Dev Center
  • UnityPluginSDK

Try building and running the project before integrating OpenFeint:

  1. Create a new empty directory in which you will build your project. We call ours UnityGame.
  2. Create a new empty project in Unity (File->New Project). We call ours UnityProject. An empty Project window appears.
  3. Select File->Build Settings.
  4. If iOS is not the currently selected Platform, then select it and then click Switch Platform.
  5. Click the Player Settings button.
  6. Change the Bundle Identifier to match the bundle identifier that is compatible with your provisioning profile. (something like com.SomeCompany.OFTest).
  7. Make sure the SDK Version is iOS latest.
  8. Make sure the API Compatibility Level dropdown is set to .NET 2.0.
  9. Make sure the Target iOS Version is 4.0 or higher.
  10. Switch back to the Build Settings window.
  11. Make sure you still have iOS selected.
  12. Make sure your iOS device is connected to your computer.
  13. Make sure you are not running XCode.
  14. Click Build (not Build and Run).
  15. In the Build iOS modal dialog box that appears:
    • Type UnityGenerated in the box labeled Save As:.
    • Make sure your project folder name appears in the box labelled Where:
    • Click Save.
  16. Open UnityGenerated/Unity-iPhone.xcodeproj in XCode 4.x or later.
    In XCode:
    • Make sure both the Unity and the iOS build targets are NOT simulators.
    • Build/run.
  17. If the project builds and successfully runs, then you should see a blue screen from the default camera.
  18. If for any reason it doesn't work, then you:
    1. Do not have the proper versions of software installed.
    2. Missed a step above.
    3. Have not configured Unity iPhone properly.

Integrating OpenFeint:

  1. Unzip the release into a subdirectory of the UnityGame subdirectory. It should be on the same level as UnityProject.
  2. Copy all of the subdirectories from the release's UnityPluginSDK/UnityPluginAssets directory (
    • GameCode,
    • Plugins,
    • Resources, and
    • Scenes
    ) into the Assets folder of the new Unity project.
  3. In the Unity IDE,, locate the Hierarchy view and select Main Camera.
  4. In the Component menu item on the Unity top menu, select Scripts. This will expand to show a list that includes Game Manager Object Initializer. Select Game Manager Object Initializer.
  5. In the Component menu item on the Unity top menu, select Scripts. This will expand to show a list that includes Render Loop. Select Render Loop.
  6. Put your game name, id, and secret into this file: /UnityGame/UnityProject/Assets/Resources/GamePreferences/properties.json.txt.
  7. Make sure XCode is not running.
  8. Now press the Build button.
  9. Make sure it says UnityGenerated in the box labeled Save As:.
  10. If you are asked to Append or Replace, click Append.
  11. Open a terminal window in the /UnityGame/UnityPluginSDK/XcodeScripts directory.

  12. Run the following script: 

    ./configure-xcode-project.sh name-of-application relative-path-to-the-UnityGenerated-folder relative-path-to-the-pluginSDK-root name-of-XCode-target

    Usage:
    Script name: 

    ./configure-xcode-project.sh


    Parameters:

    Parameter  Description
    APP_NAME  Name of your application
    XCODEPROJ_DIR_NAME  Relative path to the UnityGenerated folder
    UNITY_PLUGIN_CLASSES_SDK_DIR_PATH  Relative path to the Unity plugin SDK
    TARGET_NAME  Target

    In our case, this script looks like this: 

    ./configure-xcode-project.sh UnityProject ../../UnityProject/UnityGenerated ../../UnityPluginSDK Unity-iPhone

    If you leave all parameters blank, the script will default with the above parameters.

  13. Double-click your application (it's in UnityGenerated) to launch XCode.
  14. Download a copy of your offline config file (openfeint_offline_config.xml) from the Developer Dashboard.
  15. Create a new group in your XCode project titled config.
  16. Drag the offline config file into the config folder you just created.
  17. Build and Run your application.
